theme.title: Dotted 8th note
theme.para: In this lesson the dotted 8th note pattern in simple times is introduced:

score.music: (Metrica 2 4 NoVisible) (n * c. g+)(n * s g-)(Barra Doble)) (c (n * n l)(n * c. g+)(n * s g-)(Barra Doble)) (c (n * c g+)(n * c l g-)(n * c. g+)(n * s g-)(Barra Final))

part.title: Lesson and note the differences
part.para: As always that you find any trouble with a rhymic pattern try to get it by tying notes and study it firts without the ties. Note how the rhythm of dotted 8th note can be obtained from one 8th note and two 16th notes, when tying the 8th note.

score.music: (Metrica 2 8) (n * c g+)(n * s)(n * s g-)) (c (n * c l g+)(n * s)(n * s g-)) (c (n * c. g+)(n * s g-)) (c (n * s g+)(n * s)(n * s)(n * s g-)) (c (n * s l g+)(n * s)(n * s)(n * s g-)) (c (n * c g+)(n * s)(n * s g-)(Barra Final))

part.p:
In a similar way you can get and learn the other patterns of this lesson:
short 1 1
(Metrica 2 8) (n * n)(n * c. g+)(n * s g-)) (c (n * n l)(n * c. g+)(n * s g-)) (c (n * c g+)(n * c g-)(n * c. g+)(n * s g-)) (c (n * c g+)(n * c l g-)(n * c. g+)(n * s g-)(Barra Final))

part.para: Exercise 1 - Train your ear and practise the introduced rhythmic patterns.
